meanings.definition: The art or occupation of performing in plays, movies, or television shows.
meanings.sent1: Her dream was to pursue a career in acting and become a famous actress.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy watching the acting of talented actors on stage.
meanings.sent3: The acting in that school play was so funny, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His acting was like a beautiful painting, each movement deliberate and captivating.
meanings.sent5: The magic of acting is being able to transport the audience to another world.

meanings.definition: The act of pretending to be someone or something for a performance.
meanings.sent1: During the play, his acting as a villain was so convincing.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her acting in front of the mirror to perfect her role.
meanings.sent3: His acting as a superhero was so exaggerated, it made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her acting was like a chameleon, seamlessly transforming into different characters.
meanings.sent5: The power of acting lies in the ability to make the audience believe in the character.

meanings.definition: The process of taking action or doing something.
meanings.sent1: The acting on their plan to renovate the house began with clearing out the old furniture.
meanings.sent2: Swift acting is crucial in emergency situations to prevent further harm.
meanings.sent3: Their acting on the idea to start a band led to unexpected success.
meanings.sent4: The acting on her decision to travel the world opened up new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The bold acting on his proposal surprised everyone but brought joy to his partner.
